sentences: Désiré-Alexandre Batton (January 2, 1798 in Paris – October 15, 1855 in Versailles) was a French composer.
In 1817 he took first second price in the Prix de Rome competition for his cantata La Mort d' Adonis.
In 1842 Batton became inspector of music schools in France and in 1849 he began teaching at the Conservatoire.
